title: What is a 5G optical fiber? - Quora

response.answer_text: Fiber optic networks and their role in 5G Fiber optic networks are a type of high-speed wireline network offering improved speed, security and bandwidth over legacy copper systems. Fiber optic technology has long been used in long-haul networks due to its high performance over long distances — fiber can travel as far as 40 miles without losing signal strength.
There’s no such term. If anything there may be non-standardised 5Gbps capable Fibre but that’s unheard of, at least to me. The Role of Fiber Optic Cables in Computer Networking.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by H Abdul Khader
